article.headline: Facebook pushes earnings report to Thursday after Big Tech hearing is rescheduled
article.body: Facebook Inc. FB, +0.26% said Monday that it plans to report second-quarter earnings Thursday instead of Wednesday "due to a scheduling conflict." Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg is set to testify before the House Judiciary Committee on Wednesday at an antitrust hearing that will look into the business practices of Big Tech companies Facebook, Apple Inc. AAPL, +1.74%, Alphabet Inc. GOOGL, +1.82% GOOG, +1.97%, and Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, +3.01%. Those companies now share one more thing in common as they are all set to post earnings Thursday afternoon following Facebook's scheduling change. Facebook will hold its earnings call at 6 p.m. ET that afternoon. Alphabet's call is scheduled for 4:30 ET, while Apple's is at 5 ET and Amazon's is scheduled for 5:30 ET.
